                         Mor Armony, Associate Professor of IOMS, and OM doctoral student Tarek Abdallah discuss her research on healthcare operations.            Natalia Levina, Associate Professor of Information Systems, presents at the Future of Business Event series.            Peter Lakner, Associate Professor of Statistics and Operations Research, presents his research on impulse control.                IOMS Groups:  Information Systems • Operations Management • Statistics           – About the department          The Department of Information, Operations & Management Sciences (IOMS) is home to faculty whose research style is analytical or technology-based.    The IOMS faculty have a well known reputation for excellence in research and teaching. Their research focuses in areas such as big data, outsourcing and offshoring, online advertising, mining social media content and social networks, revenue management and pricing, stochastic processing systems, long memory time series, categorical data analysis, and strategic analysis of global warming.                            Quick Links       Our Faculty    MBA Course Descriptions    UG Course Descriptions    IOMS Seminars          Recent News       OM Professor Srikanth Jagabathula receives $500,000 in funding from the National Science Foundation CAREER Award to further his research in developing data-driven modeling and learning techniques.    IOMS course, Operations in NYC , is featured in the NY Post for innovations in teaching by IOMS professors Harry Chernoff , Kristen Sosulski , and Mor Armony .    IS Professor Anindya Ghose and former IOMS PhD Jason Chan 's recently published paper is featured in The Economist .    OM Professor Ilan Lobel was awarded the 2014 Revenue Management and Pricing Section Prize for his paper , "Optimal Dynamic Mechanism Design and the Virtual-Pivot Mechanism" at INFORMS.          Department Leadership   Alex Tuzhilin, Chair  Ed Melnick, Deputy Chair  Vasant Dhar, IS Group Head  René Caldentey, OM Group Head  Peter Lakner, Statistics Group Head          IOMS Specializations       Business Analytics (formerly Data, Models & Decisions)    Management of Technology and Operations Specialization    Digital Marketing    Financial Systems & Analytics    Supply Chain Management and Global Sourcing Specialization        Spring 2015 Course Highlight    Programming in Python: INFO-GB.2335.01   Professor Hardeep Johar  The class will focus on giving students a working knowledge of programming languages and software design methodologies. Students will learn how large and small scale computer applications work, and how to build working prototypes to illustrate and market their own ideas.        IOMS Faculty Highlight    IOMS welcomes two full-time faculty members this fall:       Hila Lifshitz-Assaf  Assistant Professor  (PhD, Harvard Business School)       Xi Chen  Assistant Professor  (PhD, Carnegie Mellon and Postdoc, University of California, Berkeley)                                                                                                             News      NYU Stern Center for Business and Human Rights to Tackle Migrant Labor Rights in the Construction Industry    Foreign Policy Association Awards Medal to Dean Peter Henry    Follow @NYUStern on Twitter and like NYU Stern on Facebook         Basics      Directions & Maps    Faculty Directory    Contact Us                                 FACULTY OPINIONS    Read Stern faculty opinions on  relevant business topics             Sitemap | Privacy | © 2015 Leonard N. Mike Pinedo                                                            Michael Pinedo      Julius   Schlesinger Professor of Operations Management Joined Stern 1996                44   West 4th Street    KMC 8-59    212-998-0287              Courses:          Operations in Financial Services   (Undergraduate)            Operations in Financial Services   (Langone)          Operations in Financial   Services (Exec MBA)                                     Education:             Ph.D. Operations Research, University of California, Berkeley, 1978     M.S. Operations Research, University of California, Berkeley, 1976     Ir. Mechanical Engineering, Delft University of Technology, Delft, The Netherlands          Books:        Planning, Scheduling & Queueing             Scheduling:   Theory, Algorithms, and Systems  (1994, 2001, 2008,   2012)            Operations    Scheduling with Applications in Manufacturing and Services (1999)      Queueing Networks:    Customers, Signals and Product Form Solutions (1999)          Planning and Scheduling in    Manufacturing and Services (2005, 2009)        Operations & Financial Services           Creating Value    in Financial Services: Strategies, Operations, and Technologies (1999)         Operational Control in Asset Management: Processes and Costs (2010)       Global Asset Management: Strategies, Risks, Processes, and Technologies (2013)          Software:            LEKIN    -- Educational Scheduling System           Journal:             Journal of Scheduling          Research Interests:                Production Planning         Scheduling      Operational Risk     Design of Decision-support Systems      Supply-chain Management in the Process Industries           Curriculum Vitae

Open Meditation and Yoga Association (OM) | NYU School of Law                          Skip to main content                                     ›               Quicklinks       Areas of Study   Calendar   Career Services   Colloquia   Courses   Departments   Directories   Docket   Housing   Library   News and Press   NYU Home   Student Links   Technology                                              JD Admissions   Faculty & Scholarship   Global Opportunities   LLM/JSD Admissions   Academics & Courses   Law & Business   Executive Education   Current Students   Public Service   About NYU Law   Alumni & Giving   Centers & Institutes                               Home › Student Organizations › Open Meditation and Yoga Association (OM)             Open Meditation and Yoga Association (OM)                 Open Meditation and Yoga Association (OM)       Events Schedule   Contact Us                           The Open Meditation and Yoga Association (OM) seeks to create a safe, supportive community space through which students can establish a healthy lifestyle and explore personal paths to inner peace. OM envisions creating a community whose members together explore practices which promote health and wellness, personal transformation and discovery of purpose. OM embraces diverse forms and practices.
